plan:
1. Initial Rounds: Bid aggressively to gather data, staying in the auction up to 75% of my value. 

2. Middle Rounds: Analyze the bidding behavior of Betty and Charles from initial rounds. If they tend to drop out early, continue aggressive bidding. If they stay in longer, adopt a conservative approach, bidding up to 50% of my value.

3. Final Rounds: Adjust strategy based on profit so far. If behind, bid aggressively, up to 80% of my value. If ahead, adopt a conservative approach, bidding up to 60% of my value.

Plan:

1. Round 1-2: Bid until reaching 70% of my value. This will provide data on the others' bidding behaviour.
2. Round 3-4: Bid until reaching 50% of my value. This will test their reactions to more conservative bidding.
3. Round 5-6: Bid aggressively, up to 90% of my value, to see if they respond to aggressive strategies.
4. Round 7-8: Bid randomly between 50% and 90% of my value, to gather data on how they adapt to unpredictable strategies.

Plan:

1. Start with a cautious approach: Bid up to half of the prize value for the initial rounds. This will allow observation of the other bidders' strategies and tendencies.

2. Gradually increase aggressiveness: Depending on the observed strategies, start bidding up to 75% of the prize value. This will test the risk tolerance of other bidders and gather data on their maximum bids.
